intro: Selliguea roseomarginata, commonly known as the rose-margin liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a terrestrial liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive morphology, featuring a thalloid structure with a leafy, lobed appearance. Its leaves are often reddish or pinkish at the margins, giving it its common name. Selliguea roseomarginata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
